newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat nine months 1996 profits falls.
newsitem.headline: Fiat nine months 1996 profits falls.

text.p: Italian automotive group Fiat said on Monday that its pretax profits in the first nine months of the 1996 fell to 1.759 trillion lire from 2.743 trillion lire, while its sales rose four percent to 57.918 trillion lire.

The group added in a statement that its cash flow in the same nine month period to the end-September slipped to 5.218 trillion lire from 5.843 trillion lire in the corresponding nine month period in 1995.
The statement said operating profits were 1.706 trillion lire, equal to 2.9 percent of sales, compared to 2.513 trillion lire, or 4.5 percent of sales, in the first nine months of 1995.

Fiat pointed out the profitablity of the group suffered from depressed demand in the Italian car market, the slow down in demand for industrial vehicles and the effect of the high value of the lira against many other world currencies.

The group said the nine-month results came before the sale of its fund management arm Prime to insurer Generali and the flotation of around 30 percent of its New Holland farm machinery division on the stock market.

Fiat Auto recorded sales up 5.2 percent to 1.74 million cars in the nine month period, with export sales to European nations rising by some 108,000, showing a rise of 24 percent in a market growing generally at around eight percent.
